{{color box|teal}} {{color box|black}} {{color box|white}} | owner = | manager = Russ Smithson | championships = 2 (2001 & 2003) | titles = | cheerleaders = | dancers = | mascot = | website = [http://www.tritonsbaseball.com/ Official Website] }} The '''White Rock Tritons''' are a youth [[baseball]] team located in the city of [[South Surrey]], [[British Columbia]]. Although most of the Tritons players are from the [[White Rock]] and South Surrey communities, the team also attracts talent from other areas around the [[Lower Mainland]] such as [[Delta,_British_Columbia|Delta]], [[Ladner,_British_Columbia|Ladner]] and [[Surrey,_British_Columbia|Surrey]], as well as attracting HS players from Blaine. Russ Smithson is the newly appointed Head Coach as of 2010/2011 season. Smithson is a Canadian Jr National Team graduate, and spent his college career on scholarship to El Paso CC in Texas, and the University of Kentucky. The team was founded in 1993, and joined the [[B.C. Premier Baseball League]] in 1999.BCPBL: [http://www.bcpbl.com/en/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=52&Itemid=71&42e49c9cb5032e7bc289b8fc6c3aa25d=msyqxurgg League History] Retrieved on 10 July 2009 The team plays their home games at [[South Surrey Athletic Park]].BCPBL: [http://www.bcpbl.com/en/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=218&Itemid=484 White Rock Tritons Home Field] Retrieved on 10 July 2009 The Tritons have sent on 78 players to college baseball, as well as 13 players signed to MLB teams, and compete in the top tournaments in Canada and the US.
